config.question: What ultimately led to the final passage of the Compromise of 1850?

choices.content: A majority of congressmen from both sections voted for the entire package.
Northern Democrats, southern Whigs, and representatives of both parties from the border states supported its key measures.
Northern Whigs and southern Democrats thought the end result was favorable to their side.
Southern Congressmen across party lines staged a walkout as the measure was being put to vote.

answer_3.response: Consider This: A majority of congressmen from both sections did not support any single bill. Only a few senators or representatives actually voted for the entire package. See L.O. 14.1 How did territorial expansion intensify the conflict over slave?
